column2: ARKANSAS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
column4: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon
column6: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon

column2: 2. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 3. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 4. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
5. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 7. When driving at night, drivers should:
column6: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. To enter a gap in traffic while driving on a highway:
column4: watch only the vehicles behind the gap.
column6: check behind, then watch the vehicle ahead.
column8: speed up and let vehicles make way.

column2: 10. Drinking alcohol:
column4: has no effect on driving ability but affects your judgement.
column6: harms both judgement and driving skills.
column8: has no effect on either judgement or driving  ability.

column2: 11. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 12. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

column2: 13. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column6: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column8: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.

column2: 14. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
16. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column6: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 17. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
18. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
19. This sign means:
20. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
22. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
23. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column6: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 24. When you see this sign, you should:
column6: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
